intro: Dulichium confervoides, commonly known as sea sedge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a perennial herb that typically grows in coastal areas, salt marshes, and brackish wetlands. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, clustered flowers that are often green or reddish in color. It is well adapted to saline environments and plays a role in stabilizing coastal soils. Dulichium confervoides is an important component of coastal ecosystems, providing habitat and food for various wildlife species.
